Key Arguments: The submission questions the legitimacy of ACMA's powers and requests a 'delegation of powers' map.
It suggests that any delegation of power more than once removed would breach the Australian Constitution.
The submission accuses the Australian Government and Western corporate organizations of being major disseminators of misinformation.
It expresses distrust in the government's ability to define misinformation and disinformation, citing past actions during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Main Themes: Distrust in government and corporate entities
Notable Quotes: Please tell me, in ten words or less, who bestowed you and/or ACMA with any powers whatsoever?
Make no mistake, the tide is turning and bad outcomes come from bad choices.
It is no measure of health to be well adjusted to a profoundly sick society.
